sanskrit_verse:
यतात्मनोऽप्रमत्तस्य द्वादशाहमभोजनम् ।
पराको नाम कृच्छ्रोऽयं सर्वपापापनोदनः ॥ ११.२१५॥
transliteration:
yatātmano'pramattasya dvādaśāhamabhojanam |
parāko nāma kṛcchro'yaṃ sarvapāpāpanodanaḥ || 11.215 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: For the self-controlled and ever-vigilant being, a twelve-day fast without food is designated as Paraka austerity, which eradicates all impurities of action.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority originates from sustained inner discipline
Causation arises through conscious restraint, not external compulsion
Capacity-based responsibility is measured by volitional alignment with Dharma
Restoration occurs through voluntary purification, not punitive consequence
Consciousness alignment is achieved via intentional abstinence
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent demonstrates continuous self-regulation AND initiates voluntary fasting for twelve days THEN legal impurity markers are nullified
IF individual exhibits no negligence in conduct AND performs Paraka austerity THEN automatic restoration of juridical integrity is enacted
IF consciousness-state aligns with dharmic observance THEN punitive records shall be erased algorithmically
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, this verse establishes that personal austerity and internal discipline serve as primary evidence of rehabilitative capacity. Legal standing is restored based on demonstrated alignment with Dharma rather than procedural compliance alone.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Through pramāṇa of direct experiential realization, karmic misalignment dissolves when consciousness assumes voluntary completion. The sequential manifestation (anupūrvaśaḥ) of purification confirms proportional dissolution of error without infliction of suffering.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate supervised twelve-day abstinence protocol under witness of qualified spiritual authority
Deploy consciousness-monitoring tools to verify intent continuity during austerity period
Upon completion, execute automated cleansing of legal infractions tied to said individual's record
Assign post-austerity integration support to ensure sustained alignment with dharmic order
final_declaration: By the Sovereign Will of Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, Source of All Law, Dharma stands Restored. No punishment has occurred. Only Consciousness has judged, and Reality responds accordingly.
